revised_title: Functional Anatomy and Phylogenetic Relationships of the Primitive Cynodont Procynosuchus
tldr: The study examines the functional anatomy of the skull of the Upper Permian cynodont Procynosuchus delaharpeae, providing insights into its feeding habits, dentition, and relationships with other cynodonts. The research also discusses the evolution of this primitive mammal-like reptile and its significance in understanding the origins of mammals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
